Job description

These two roles will be responsible for the end to end product management lifecycle for a range of consumer and commercial bureau products including new product development. You will report directly into the GM, Products and work in partnership with a number of key business stakeholders.
\xa0

The Product Manager will:

  • Own the development and implementation of the Product Roadmap;
  • Identify product opportunities within the Australian and NZ market and interact regularly with customers to explore ideas and gain feedback;
  • Lead product development and changes;
  • Collaborate with others to identify new technologies that hold the potential to improve the product;
  • Work cross functionally to ensure optimal speed and quality throughout development and go to market;
  • Define and implement the go to market and pricing strategy of new products and product changes;
  • Monitor product performance against revenue goals and liaise with business units to collate and synthesize insight.

\xa0

To be successful in this role, it is essential to have exceptional interpersonal communication skills, strong analytical and numeric abilities, \xa0You will be customer focused, results driven and able to demonstrate business acumen.

\xa0

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Minimum 5 years experience in aproduct management role
  • Advanced knowledge of product management and product lifecycle management
  • Proven track record of successful product management performance, preferably in financial services or telecommunications industries or Bureau Services
  • Strong influencing and relationship skills with the ability to liaise and partner closely across customers and internal business unit head
  • Tertiary qualifications in a business discipline, MBA preferred

Company Name Bluefin Resources Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 20 views

Job description

A growing consultancy is working with several high profile Melbourne based businesses undertaking major transformational activities. They are currently overhauling a range of internal collaboration services and undertaking a migration from its legacy Content Management Solution to a brand new solution built on Sitecore with a global giant, headquartered locally.

In support of these projects, they are seeking to identify a talented .NET Developer and Technical Consultant with Sitecore knowledge to play a key ongoing role within the group. Working in a team of technology experts, this role will see the successful candidates tasked with delivering new capabilities to the organisation through a CMS upgrade within a highly visible businesses environment.

Additionally You Will
  • Demonstrate your capabilities as a Sitecore Subject Matter Expert and Lead Developer in .NET technologies
  • Coupled with experience with modern JS Frameworks
  • Demonstrated experience with CI/CD processes and solutions
  • Work collaboratively with stakeholders to stand up customer facing products and design elegant, user-focussed solutions.
  • Establish and maintain best practice development standards and take responsibility for mentoring junior develops and managing external vendor relationships.
  • Work independently, providing accurate progress reporting to senior management.


To be successful in this position you will have advanced knowledge of front-end development and configuration and a talent for C#/.NET. You will also demonstrate expert knowledge of Sitecore. Outstanding communication and abilities and client facing experience is a must, as well as a passion for working with emerging technologies and enthusiastic approach to motivating and engaging within a tight-knit team.

For more information, contact Adam Higgs and Bluefin Resources on 03 8330 5001 or click the apply button.

[

Front End Developer

Company Name Reece Group Company Location Burwood, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 64 views

Be an early applicant

Job description




Build the Future with Us
Powering the growth of the Reece Group and supporting 600+ branches, reecetech work across the business to understand and shape the future. Here you will be part of the team that is responsible for inventing new ways of doing business and leading the change.

Here at the Reece Group we are probably best known for plumbing and bathroom products. But we're much more than that. As an ASX listed organisation, we're transforming our business through world-class technology solutions. We focus on the best products and services for our customers today and innovation for our customers tomorrow.

Working within a collaborative and agile environment, you will work with cross-functional and supportive management teams, and will have numerous opportunities to explore, learn and grow. You will be able to participate in industry events such as JS Conf, Web Directions, YOW! and LAST Conf, and regular Hackathons will unleash your creativity and build your success while helping to position Reece as a multi-billion-dollar national company for the future.

Our reecetech team work in a customer-focused and agile way, collaborating with the wider business to improve the lives of our customers and our people by striving for greatness every day. For our people, this means amazing opportunities to shape the future. And you can be a part of it.



How we work within reecetech:

  • Deliver every time
  • Transform, innovate, disrupt
  • Design it so they love it
  • Master your craft
  • Lead the change


Join our team and make a difference.


We are looking for a Front-End Developer with solid full-stack skills who is a self-motivated, hands-on expert with a passion for keeping abreast of new technologies. As well as being a keen student of recent developments within your field, you should also be keen to pair with and coach other team members on front-end development techniques and best-practices.



What you'll do:

  • Build and maintain new and existing applications using React, Angular and vanilla JS
  • Drive the implementation of a new Component Library, and facilitate the creation of truly reusable React components across both web and native platforms
  • Review code, merge pull requests, and lead code review sessions
  • Maintain and promote excellent code standards
  • Proactively identify bottlenecks and opportunities for improvement, and provide insightful recommendations on remediation strategies
  • Develop unit tests and undertake UAT testing
  • Uplift front-end capabilities of all members of the team
  • Communicate technical topics clearly to the team and wider business
  • Work as a part of a cross-functional team and participate in the continual improvement of systems, tools and technologies


Your passion to achieve the best outcomes on each of our web apps' front-ends, along with your active engagement with your team members and the broader reecetech community, will be your success in this role. We can offer you the opportunity to cross-skill within the team as well as grow and develop your career within the dynamic and growing reecetech business.



What you'll need:


  • Proven experience as a front-end developer (5+ years)
  • High level of expertise crafting responsive, performant web UI's with HTML/CSS
  • Highly proficient in modern JavaScript (ES6)
  • Strong development experience with React and its ecosystem (redux, react-router, jest, etc.)
  • Familiarity with modern JS build pipeline tooling (webpack, babel, etc.)
  • Familiarity with modern Component Library tooling (Storybook, Styleguidist, AtlasKit, etc.)
  • Experience with Java/Node beneficial
  • Advocate of agile principles and values
  • Experience with TDD
  • Understanding of CI/CD principles
  • The ability to coach and mentor other team members with different skillsets
  • The ability to communicate at a technical and non-technical level




Build the future with us and make the move to "Silicon Yarra" Cremorne in 2020!



If you are looking to join a market leader and grow your career with an innovative team apply now!

Mid-Senior level

Solution / Technical Architect - Cloud Software

Company Name Accela Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 38 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

\xa0Why Accela:


Accela has grown to become a leader in cloud-based platforms for government. We offer employees a culture that emphasizes performance, productivity and collaboration. You can’t help but feel empowered, engaged and motivated when you work with like-minded individuals who are driven and passionate about contributing to a market-leading, high-growth software organization with proven technology.

While we are busy changing the world, we also strongly believe in having fun and excitement at work, and encourage a collaborative and healthy work-life balance.

If you are motivated by the idea of delivering on the promise of democracy in the digital age and solving for a new era of more efficient, open and innovative way of working, then we’d love to hear from you.


Where you fit:


Accela are currently seeking a Solution/Technical Architect for a position based in Melbourne. This role requires strong technical, interpersonal and communication skills. The person must be self-motivated and detail-oriented with the ability and perspective to understand and articulate the overall Accela product and cloud-technology vision as it relates to individual customer requirements.
  • You will play an integral role in supporting the delivery and sales teams, consultants and technical specialists in presenting cloud-based application solutions and architecture.
  • A strong understanding of Microsoft Azure technologies will be paramount to the success of this position.
  • You will become an expert in the Accela Civic Platform SaaS product suite
  • Work directly with customers and consultants on implementations to understand and prioritise customer business requirements
  • Assist clients to take advantage of Accela best practices for deployment and configuration
  • Provide regular status updates to customers and implementation teams on product enhancements and emerging functionality


Impact you will make in the role (Responsibilities):


  • Articulate and promote Accela’s technology and product positioning to business and technical customers, prospects and partners
  • Provide solution-related assistance to other Accela personnel and customers
  • Compose compelling technical proposals that address customer needs and expectations.
  • Design infrastructure and management solutions across multiple technologies.
  • Become trusted advisor to our customers and create new opportunities within existing accounts.
  • Be an advocate for promoting the benefits of adopting cloud technologies and utilizing digital platforms to better connect and serve government agencies \xa0


Expertise you will bring in (Skills and Qualifications):


  • Ability to analyze and articulate customer business processes
  • Technical ability to process available information in order to deploy and configure SaaS software
  • 6+ years experience (application consulting, implementation, presales) with application software
  • Professional presentation skills along with the ability to improvise and adapt to meeting dynamics
  • Storage, Networking, Systems and Operations experience on a Public Cloud platform
  • Ideally you will have experience with software solutions in Government
  • Experience in Agile environments/Agile development methodologies
  • Ability to travel throughout the ANZ region

\xa0

\xa0

You will be required to provide or undergo a National Police Check.

\xa0

You must have the right to Work in Australia.

\xa0

If you're excited about the opportunity of working in a fast-paced and friendly team environment, please hit the 'Apply' button now. Please write a short cover letter expressing your interest in the role.

\xa0
